intro: Ophrypetalum odoratum subsp. longipedicellatum, commonly known as the long-stemmed sweet-scented orchid, is a species native to Southeast Asia. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its fragrant, showy flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and marshy areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in a basal rosette, while the inflorescence consists of a raceme of fragrant, white to pale pink flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its elongated pedicels, which give it its common name.
